net.java.jddac.common.type
Class JddacId

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.type.JddacId

public class JddacId
extends java.lang.Object

A class to represent a JddacId fields. The JddacId serves several functions:

  • Unique identifier for an entity (instance) or data element in the system corresponding to a 1451.1 ObjectID.
  • Provide a way to address and enable message delivery to a network addressable entity. This corresponds to the concept of an IEEE 1451.1 ObjectDispatchAddress.
  • Serve as a publication destination address.
Since the Jddac Id is used for message delivery, it can be treated as either a 'source identifier' or a 'destination address' depending on the context. In most cases it will serve as a source identifier providing identity information to data publications but it also can be used as a destination address for directed publications or client/server communications.

The Jddac Id can be summarized with the following components:

jddac://<authority>/<local path>?<additional parameters>

<authority>=<identity>@<identityHost>

<local path> = <type>[/<name>]

    
Destination:
jddac://<identity>@<identityHost>/p/<topic>(for publications only)
Destination:
jddac://<identity>@<identityHost>/i/<entityName>(for client-server only)
From:
jddac://<identity>@<identityHost>/i/<entity name>
Pub:
jddac:// <identity>@<identityHost>/p/<topic>
The <identity>@<identityHost>portion is a globally unique form of identity where <identity>is a unique string within the domain of <identityHost>. This combination is primarily used to uniquely identify a specific NCAP but can also be used to identify a specific user. The following are example Jddac Ids.

User account 'glenne' on server jddac.labs.agilent.com:

jddac://glenn@jddac.labs.agilent.com

A block instance named 'reporter' in an ncap associated with the id ABCD-EFGH on the identity server jddac.labs.agilent.com:

jddac://ABCD-EFGH@jddac.labs.agilent.com/i/reporter

A measurement on the 'temperature' channel of the 'sensor' block instance:

jddac://ABCD-EFGH@jddac.labs.agilent.com/i/sensor?ch=temperature

JddacId and RFC2396

The Jddac Id is based on the URI syntax defined in RFC2396. Please refer to RFC2396 for complete definitions and character restrictions for these components. A portion is repeated here for easy reference but in all cases the Jddac Id is a subset of the RFC specification so a general RFC2396 URI can be used on Jddac Ids.

    
absoluteURI = scheme ":" ( hier_part | opaque_part )
hier_part = ( net_path | abs_path ) [ "?" query ]
net_path = "//" authority [ abs_path ]
abs_path = "/" path_segments
authority = server | reg_name
server = [ [ userinfo "@" ] hostport ]
hostport = host [ ":" port ]
host = hostname | IPv4address
Jddac does not support registry based naming so the authority field does not include the option described in RFC2396 allowing authority to also be specified as <reg_name>. Leveraging the above results in the Jddac friendly BNF form below.
    
JddacId = "jddac:" hier_part
hier_part = ( net_path | abs_path ) [ "?" query ]
net_path = "//" authority [ abs_path ]
abs_path = "/" path_segments
authority = [ [ identity "@" ] identityServer ]
identityServer = hostname | IPv4address
identity = *( unreserved | escaped | ";" | ":" | "&" | "=" | "+" | "$" | "," )
path_segments = entity_instance | publication
entity_instance = "i/" name
publication = "p/" topic
name = 1*pchar
topic = 1*pchar

setDefaultAuthority

public static void setDefaultAuthority(java.lang.String auth)
Set default authority used when one has not been specified. This is a static class value used for all instances of JddacId in the VM. This value is normally set by the NCAP Block based on configured settings.

Parameters:
auth - A String representing the new default authority setting.

Parameters:
id - A string representing the identity portion of a JddacId.

getAuthority

public java.lang.String getAuthority()
Get the authority portion of the JddacId. The authority portion of the Jddac id combines both the identity and the identity server portions and looks something like "id@identityServer". If the identity portion of the JddacId is null then just the identity Server portion is returned without the '@' separator, e.g. "identityServer". If the identityServer portion is null then just the identity portion is returned ("id@"). If both portions are null then null is returned.

Returns:
A String representing the authority portion of the JddacId.

setAuthority

public void setAuthority(java.lang.String auth)
Set the authority portion of the JddacId. The authority takes the form of "id@identityServer".

Parameters:
auth - A String representing the authority portion of a JddacId.

toShortString

public java.lang.String toShortString()
Return a String representation of this JddacId without including settings from the default authority. This method differs from toString only in the use of the default authority setting. This method should be used when an abbreviated String representation is suitable.

Returns:
The short JddacId String.

isDefaultAuthority

public boolean isDefaultAuthority()
Returns if authority is same as default authority

Returns:
